data.title: Christmas at the Chateau (2019)
data.meta_description: Three sisters try to save the Shakespeare Chateau, a historic mansion and beloved family home, from a corrupt bank that threatens to foreclose on Christmas Day. But things get complicated when one of them falls in love with one of the bankers.
data.text:
Once or maybe twice in a lifetime a movie comes along that makes you wonder: is this the worst piece of shit I’ve ever seen? Folks, I have a serious contender.

Two exhibits:

1. There’s a heated dialogue between two coworkers that’s all ADR. The shot actually seems to be an outtake where neither is talking and one of actors is mostly out of frame.

2. In the midst of a flirtatious back-and-forth we cut to another scene—with the same two characters—in a different location. That moment plays with the sound from the first shot overlapping. Oh, also, the cutaway seems to be another outtake.

Amazing.

She was my wife, Brooke. She died of cancer.

This movie is completely insane. Not an ounce of it makes any sense at all and the leads have 0 chemistry. But it also has everything you could ever want: single dads, ghost reveals, 2 narrators, misused Shakespeare quotes, and a script trying to force emotion on you so hard it starts to get uncomfortable.

But you’ll laugh. Oh how you’ll laugh.

this movie is my favorite christmas movie. the laughter this masterpiece brings. not a single element of this film is done correctly and it is the funniest most entertaining christmas movie. i show it to all my friends and my family watches it every christmas. if you’re in need of laughter and confusion at how something like this exists so freely, christmas at the chateau is the movie for you. absolute favorite film of mine.
